Kate Storey-Fisher

Updates

  • July–August 2022: I visited MPIA in Heidelberg, where I worked with Hans-Walter Rix and David W. Hogg on the Gaia quasars.
  • June 2022: I attended EAS2022, the European Astronomical Society meeting, in Valencia, Spain, where I co-organized the special session Critical Challenges for Machine Learning in Astronomy and gave two talks. (I also did the Astro Run!)
  • June 2022: I participated in the Gaia Fête at Flatiron CCA.
  • May 2022: I attended the Astronomical Software Workshop at Flatiron CCA.
  • March 2022: I attended the workshop From Data to Software to Science with the Rubin Observatory LSST at Flatiron CCA.
  • February 2022: I gave the grad student seminar at NYU on my work emulating galaxy clustering statistics.
  • December 2021: I remotely gave an Early Career Researcher cosmology seminar at CosKASI on my emulation project.
  • December 2021: I presented (in person!) at GothamFest 2021 at CCA.
  • November 2021: I gave a remote talk at the Statistics & ML Journal Club at UToronto Astro on my GAN anomaly detection work.
  • September 2021: Our paper on equivariant ML was accepted to NeurIPS 2021!
  • September 2021: My work on anomalous galaxy detection with GANs in HSC was published.
  • September 2021: I gave a remote talk at ML Club via the Applied Artificial Intelligence Initiative at UCSC.
  • August 2021: The project I worked on during my stint at the South African Astronomical Observatory on the CGM in the Simba simulations was published.
  • August 2021: I presented on my work emulating beyond-standard clustering statistics at the Learn the Universe workshop at CCA.
  • July 2021: I spoke (remotely) at the ML in Astronomy meeting at Western Sydney University, Australia, on my weird galaxy project.
  • June 2021: My collaborator Abby Williams presented our work measuring gradients in clustering at AAS238.
  • April 2021: I gave a virtual talk to Amateur Astronomers, Inc. in New Jersey on “How Galaxies Shed Light on Dark Matter”.
  • January 2021: I gave a virtual seminar at the German Center for Cosmological Lensing on my correlation function estimator work.
  • December 2020: I virtually attended NeurIPS 2020, where I co-presented a tutorial on ML for Astrophysics, and presented my work on GANs for anomaly detection at the ML4PS workshop.
  • December 2020: I remotely gave the Center for Computational Astrophysics Thursday lunch talk.
  • November 2020: I virtually gave the Princeton/IAS Cosmology Lunch Talk on “binning is sinning”.
  • November 2020: I submitted my first first-author paper!
  • August 2021: I gave a virtual talk at Astronomy on Tap, Kingston on “How To Grow Your Own Universe”.
  • June 2020: I (remotely) attended ComSciCon, a workshop on science communication for graduate students.
  • May 2020: I was awarded the NASA Future Investigators in NASA Earth and Space Science and Technology (FINESST) to fund the rest of my PhD!
  • Feburary 2020: I passed my oral qualifying exam to become a PhD candidate!
  • January 2020: I gave a research talk and led a science communication workshop at AAS235 in Honolulu, Hawai’i.
  • December 2019: I was elected co-chair of our new grad student org at NYU, G-PHORCE (Graduate Physics Organization for Research, Culture, and Education).
  • October 2019: I attended the dotAstronomy conference in Toronto (where I made the @arrrXiv twitter bot).
  • September 2019: I presented at GothamFest, New York’s annual festival of astronomy talks.
  • July 2019: I helped author a paper with Astrobites on the site as a model for education and SciComm.
  • July-August 2019: I was a Kavli Student Fellow at the Kavli Summer Program in Astrophysics at UC Santa Cruz, on Machine Learning in the Era of Large Astronomical Surveys.
  • May 2019: I attended the Emulation of Galaxy Clustering workshop at the CCAPP at Ohio State University.
  • March-April 2019: I led a teaching team at the Professional Development Program’s Inquiry institute in Monterey, CA, and the Design Institute in Boulder, CO.
  • December 2019: I completed the Advanced Science Communication Workshop at NYU’s Carter Journalism Institute.
  • July 2018: I attended the Summer School on Large Scale Structure in Berlin.
  • March-April 2018: I attended the PDP Inquiry institute in Monterey, CA, and the Design Institute in Houston, TX.
  • December 2018: I completed the Science Communication Workshop at NYU’s Carter Journalism Institute.
